text: I think this game has the best battle system out of the lot of them. :D
author: ladatree

text: Tales of the Abyss is much better in my opinion, though Vesperia is a great play too. I greatly love the Tales series, they are my all-time favorites, even more so than the FF series. You should definitely give Abyss a whirl if you haven't already. The battle system is astoundingly addictive =]
author: Xzaithyr Grymhart

text: So I am about 6 or 7 hours in. I have enjoyed it a lot so far. I agree with wanting some more animation in the characters. I did feel that the titles were explained a lot. There are lots of tutorial parts for the first few hours. I have really enjoyed the game, and felt that the story has been interesting so far. I like the battle system and the skits too. The eleth mixer is still strange to me. Asbel is pretty standard fare but still likeable.
author: Postmita

text:
not as amazing as i was hoping, story feels pretty dull compared to previous Tales of Games, it is however still enjoyable. It pays a lot of homage to Tales of destiny 1 and 2 (i believe it was those two) with it's battle system and skit art style.

all in all the only isues i have with this game are:
-I wish the game did better at explaining the importance that titles play in learning new artes and getting stronger
-I wish they put more animation/feeling into the characters

text: The music to this Tales game is surly like no other. I don't get that T.O.A. feel or the feel of T.O.S. that I received in T.O.V. The music here is pretty different, but it's still great, nonetheless. I'll be looking forward to getting this soundtrack as well. ^_^
